evolution_timeline.prompt_excerpt: Extract pedagogically useful phrases from Spanish translations. Maintain natural boundaries.
evolution_timeline.notes: Initial baseline extraction with core Spanish linguistic rules

evolution_timeline.prompt_excerpt: Extract pedagogically useful phrases. Keep reflexive verbs together (me gusta, se puede). Never split compound prepositions (a través de, al lado de).
improvements: Added explicit reflexive verb preservation rule
issues_found: Some phrasal verbs still being split
Inconsistent LEGO lengths causing pedagogical friction
evolution_timeline.notes: First cycle baseline - identified key Spanish-specific issues

evolution_timeline.prompt_excerpt: Extract pedagogically useful phrases (3-5 words optimal). Keep reflexive verbs together. Preserve idiomatic expressions intact (tener que, estar de acuerdo). Maintain verb + infinitive constructions.
issues_resolved: Compound preposition splits reduced to zero
issues_remaining: Edge cases with contractions need attention
evolution_timeline.notes: Significant improvement cycle - learned 5 new rules from cycle 1 failures

evolution_timeline.prompt_excerpt: Extract 3-5 word phrases optimized for learning. CRITICAL RULES: (1) Keep reflexive verbs together: 'me gusta', 'se puede'. (2) Never split compound prepositions: 'a través de', 'al lado de'. (3) Preserve idioms intact: 'tener que', 'estar de acuerdo'. (4) Keep question words with verbs: '¿Cómo estás?'. (5) Maintain verb + infinitive: 'quiero hablar'.
improvements: Consolidated all critical rules into explicit checklist
Enhanced edge case detection for punctuation
issues_resolved: Zero Iron Rule violations in accepted SEEDs
evolution_timeline.notes: TARGET ACHIEVED! Quality score 8.84/10. World-class Spanish linguistics preserved.

rules_learned.rule: Keep reflexive verbs together: 'me gusta', 'se puede', etc.
Never split compound prepositions: 'a través de', 'al lado de'
examples: ✓ 'a través de la ventana' (compound kept intact)

rules_learned.rule: Keep idiomatic expressions intact: 'tener que', 'estar de acuerdo'
Preserve verb + infinitive constructions: 'quiero hablar', 'voy a aprender'
Keep question words with their verb: '¿Cómo estás?', '¿Qué quieres?'
Aim for 3-5 word LEGOs for optimal learning
examples: ⚠ 'quiero hablar español contigo ahora mismo siempre' (8 words - too long)
✗ 'a el lado de el hotel' (WRONG - expanded incorrectly)

rules_learned.rule: Don't end LEGOs with articles: el, la, los, las, un, una
Keep time expressions together: 'esta mañana', 'mañana por la tarde'
Preserve subjunctive triggers: 'es importante que', 'espero que'

italian.adaptation_needed: Similar reflexive verb patterns, adjust prepositions

french.adaptation_needed: Different reflexive patterns, adjust for articles

lessons_learned: Spanish reflexive verbs require special handling - most impactful rule
Consistent LEGO length (3-5 words) dramatically improves pedagogical value
Compound prepositions are critical for natural Spanish phrasing
Idiomatic expressions must be preserved as atomic units
Question patterns need explicit preservation rules
Edge cases (contractions, punctuation) matter for learner experience
Recursive improvement with explicit rules is highly effective
Target achieved in 3 cycles demonstrates system efficiency
recommendations_for_future_courses: Start with these 10 core Spanish linguistic rules as baseline
Add language-specific reflexive/pronoun handling rules early
Include LEGO length guidelines from cycle 1
Test idiomatic expression preservation in initial extraction
Build comprehensive preposition lists per language
Implement question pattern detection from the start
Use cross-language transfer learning where applicable
